snippet: A correspondent for Al Jazeera is arrested while other journalists are scolded for failing to portray the crackdown in the government’s terms: as a war against violent terrorists.
abstract: Egyptian government installed by Gen Abdul-Fattah el-Sisi is putting pressure on foreign news media, only remaining news outlets covering criticism of the violence; correspondent for Al Jazeera is arrested while other journalists are scolded for failing to portray the crackdown in the government’s terms, as a war against violent terrorists.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh and Asmaa Al Zohairy contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A correspondent for Al Jazeera is arrested while other journalists are scolded for failing to portray the crackdown in the government’s terms: as a war against violent terrorists.

headline.main: Egypt Lashes Out at Foreign News Media’s Coverage
headline.print_headline: Egypt Lashes Out at Foreign News Media’s Coverage

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
